data.text: Anger slays even wise men;
The tongue of the wise knows what is good:
The eyes of the Lord behold
The wholesome tongue is a tree of life,
A fool scorns his fatherâ€™s instruction:
In the houses of the righteous is much strength:
The lips of the wise are bound by discretion:
The sacrifices of the ungodly are an abomination to the Lord;
The ways of an ungodly man are an abomination to the Lord;
The instruction of the simple is known by them that pass by;
Hell and destruction are manifest to the Lord;
An uninstructed person will not love those that reprove him;
When the heart rejoices the countenance is cheerful;
An upright heart seeks discretion;
The eyes of the wicked are always looking for evil things;
Better is a small portion with the fear of the Lord,
Better is an entertainment of herbs with friendliness and kindness,
A passionate man stirs up strife;
A man slow to anger will extinguish quarrels;
The ways of sluggards are strewn with thorns;
A wise son gladdens his father;
The ways of a foolish man are void of sense;
They that honor not councils put off deliberation;
A bad man will by no means attend to counsel;
The thoughts of the wise are ways of life,
The Lord pulls down the houses of scorners;
An unrighteous thought is abomination to the Lord;
A receiver of bribes destroys himself;
By alms and by faithful dealings sins are purged away;
The hearts of the righteous meditate faithfulness;
The ways of righteous men are acceptable with the Lord;
God is far from the ungodly;
Better are small receipts with righteousness,
Let the heart of a man think justly,
The eye that sees rightly rejoices the heart;
He that rejects instruction hates himself;
The fear of the Lord is instruction and wisdom;
